intro: Tetracera willdenowiana subsp. willdenowiana, commonly known as the willdenow's tetracera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of tropical Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
